p: A number of other chronic or repeated infections have previously been shown to influence immune phenotypes and have an impact on vaccine responses ( Stelekati and Wherry, 2012). All participants were negative for acute or chronic hepatitis B, hepatitis C, HIV, and Plasmodium spp. infections at enrollment. Serostatus for 19 different pathogens was determined for all participants in both cohorts ( Fig. 5)
